Description¶

Dependency node plug operations in Maya.

Creation¶

A dependency node plug uses an attribute like a template. The attribute defines the data type, name and default value for the plug. When an attribute is added to a node, a plug object is instantiated from the attribute.

  • A static attribute can act as the template for a plug on multiple dependency nodes.
  • A dynamic attribute can act as the template for a plug on a single dependency node.

Connections¶

Plugs enable the flow of data through the dependency graph. A pair of connected plugs forms an edge or a dependency in the graph over which data can flow.

Access¶

A dependency node plug can be accessed via an OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulation. Each plug is defined in terms of a dependency node, an attribute and an array of attribute indices that plot a path from the root of the plug.

Note

  1. Plugs cannot have both OpenMaya.MPlug.isKeyable and OpenMaya.MPlug.isChannelBox properties True. Setting one True will set the other False.

Note

  1. Elements of an array plug are stored sparsely meaning there is no guarantee that elements will have contiguous logical indices.

Note

  1. An element plug is only considered in-use if it exists in the dataBlock of its associated dependency node. An element can be placed into the dataBlock by forcing an evaluate of the plug.

Note

  1. If a plug holds complex data, it can usually be accessed via OpenMaya.MPlug.asMObject(). The result can then be manipulated using a subclass of OpenMaya.MFnData that is compatible with the specific OpenMaya.MObject type.

Note

  1. Locking an ancestor plug has a global affect on the lock state of each descendant plug. A descendant plug can therefore be locked even if it is not internally locked. The OpenMaya.MPlug.isLocked property can be used to get the global lock state of a plug or set the internal lock state of a plug.

Warning

  1. Locking an ancestor plug will not have an immediate affect on the lock state of any descendant element plug which is not yet considered in-use. This has the potential to cause an invalid state if a connection is made to one of the elements. Upon making a connection the lock state of the element will be updated as it is now considered in-use. Attempting to undo the connection will cause Maya to crash.
class msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.PackArray(arrayPlug, inputPlugs=None, allowMultiples=False, stateTracking=True)¶

Bases: msTools.core.py.metaclasses.AbstractAccessWrapper

An interface for managing input connections to the elements of a dependency node array plug.

Inputs:

When making a connection via the interface, each input must be given as an OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulation of a dependency node plug.

Cleaning:

The interface enforces a cleaning routine that is run as a preliminary step before querying or modifying existing connections. Cleaning of the array is implemented as clean().

Validation:

The interface provides the option to track the functional state of the internal OpenMaya.MPlug. When tracking is enabled, a msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaObjectError will be raised when attempting to access the interface of an invalid encapsulation. The isValid property and __repr__() method will remain accessible regardless of whether the functional state is invalid.

Note

Instances of this class maintain a unique reference to their internal OpenMaya.MPlug to ensure the referenced dependency node plug does not change. This enables the logical indices of the OpenMaya.MPlug to be cached for efficient comparison.

allowMultiples¶

Whether multiple elements of the encapsulated plug can be connected to a single input plug.

Access:RW
Type:bool
isConnected¶

True if at least one element of the encapsulated plug has a destination connection, otherwise False.

Access:R
Type:bool
isValid¶

True if the internal OpenMaya.MPlug references a valid dependency node plug, otherwise False.

Note

This method is not subject to stateTracking and is therefore accessible even if the encapsulated dependency node plug is removed.

Access:R
Type:bool
partialName¶

The partial name of the encapsulated plug with format '<node>.<plug>'.

  • <node> will be a partial node name qualified by a path and namespace where applicable or necessary. It is guaranteed to uniquely identify the plug’s node with the minimum amount of information necessary (partial path of a DAG node).
  • <plug> is guaranteed to uniquely identify the plug with the minimum amount of information necessary (short attribute path, short attribute names).
Access:R
Type:str
plug¶

A copy of the internal plug object.

Access:R
Type:OpenMaya.MPlug
plugId¶

Identifier for the internal OpenMaya.MPlug.

Access:R
Type:msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MPlugId
stateTracking¶

Whether to track the state of the internal OpenMaya.MPlug in order to restrict access to the public interface if invalid.

Restriction involves raising an msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaObjectError upon attempting to access a bound instance attribute from the public interface. The following bindings are excluded: __repr__(), isValid.

Access:RW
Type:bool
__eq__(other)¶

x.__eq__(y) <==> x == y.

Parameters:other (any) – Any object.
Returns:bool – If other has an equivalent type, return whether its contents (dependency node plug) are equivalent. Otherwise swap the operands and return the result, unless the operands have already been swapped in which case the result is False.
__init__(arrayPlug, inputPlugs=None, allowMultiples=False, stateTracking=True)¶

Initialize an encapsulation for a dependency node array plug.

Parameters:
  • arrayPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node array plug.
  • inputPlugs (iterable [OpenMaya.MPlug], optional) – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs. Each input is connected to the next available arrayPlug element. Defaults to None.
  • allowMultiples (bool, optional) – Whether multiple arrayPlug elements can be connected to a single input plug. Defaults to False - Any existing duplicates will be removed from the tail end of the array.
  • stateTracking (bool, optional) – Whether to track the functional state of the arrayPlug. Defaults to True - Access to the interface is conditional upon this state.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If arrayPlug does not reference a dependency node array plug.
__len__()¶

x.__len__() <==> len(x).

Returns:int – The number of destination connections to the encapsulated plug.
__ne__(other)¶

x.__ne__(y) <==> x != y.

Parameters:other (any) – Any object.
Returns:bool – The negation of __eq__().
__repr__()¶

x.__repr__() <==> repr(x).

Note

This method is not subject to stateTracking and is therefore accessible even if the internal OpenMaya.MPlug is functionally invalid. In this case cached data is used.

Returns:str – A string representation of the dependency node plug encapsulation.
append(inputPlug)¶

Connect an input plug to the next available element of the encapsulated plug after cleaning.

Parameters:inputPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
Raises:RuntimeError – If there are any connection issues between an input and a corresponding element plug. See connect().
clean()¶

Removes sparcity from the encapsulated plug by removing any disconnected elements. Removes any duplicate input connections from the tail end of the array if allowMultiples is False.

Note

This method acts as the basis for all query and modify operations provided by the PackArray interface.

Returns:(list [msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MPlugId], list [msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MPlugId]) – A two-element tuple.
  1. A sequence of dependency node plug encapsulations representing the input plugs for elements of the encapsulated plug.
  2. A sequence of dependency node plug encapsulations representing the element plugs of the encapsulated plug.
clear()¶

Removes all input connections to elements of the encapsulated plug

copy(inputPlugs)¶

Replace all input connections to elements of the encapsulated plug with a new sequence.

Parameters:inputPlugs (iterable [OpenMaya.MPlug]) – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs.
Raises:RuntimeError – If there are any connection issues between an input and a corresponding element plug. See connect().
extend(inputPlugs)¶

Connect input plugs to the next available elements of the encapsulated plug after cleaning.

Parameters:inputPlugs (iterable [OpenMaya.MPlug]) – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs.
Raises:RuntimeError – If there are any connection issues between an input and a corresponding element plug. See connect().

Return the connected element plugs for the encapsulated plug after cleaning.

Returns:list [OpenMaya.MPlug] – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs for the connected elements of the encapsulated plug after cleaning.
getExistingElementPlugs()¶

Return existing element plugs for the encapsulated plug without cleaning.

Returns:list [OpenMaya.MPlug] – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs for the existing elements of the encapsulated plug.
getInputNodes()¶

Return nodes connected to each element of the encapsulated plug.

Returns:list [OpenMaya.MObject] – Wrappers of dependency nodes connected as inputs to elements of the encapsulated plug.
getInputPlugs()¶

Return plugs connected to each element of the encapsulated plug.

Returns:list [OpenMaya.MPlug] – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs connected as inputs to elements of the encapsulated plug.
hasInputNode(node)¶

Check if a dependency node is connected as an input to an element of the encapsulated plug.

Parameters:node (OpenMaya.MObject) – Wrapper of a dependency node.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If node does not reference a dependency node.
Returns:bool – True if node is connected as an input to an element of the encapsulated plug, otherwise False.
hasInputPlug(plug)¶

Check if a dependency node plug is connected as an input to an element of the encapsulated plug.

Parameters:plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
Returns:bool – True if plug is connected as an input to an element of the encapsulated plug, otherwise False.
insert(index, inputPlug)¶

Connect an input plug to an element of the encapsulated plug corrresponding to a specific index after cleaning.

Note

Any packed element with a logical index greater or equal to the insertion index will be reconnected at an incremented index.

Parameters:
  • index (int) – The index at which to insert the inputPlug connection after cleaning the encapsulated plug.
  • inputPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
Raises:
  • RuntimeError – If there are any connection issues between an input and a corresponding element plug. See connect().
  • IndexError – If index is out of range after the encapsulated plug has been cleaned.
remove(index)¶

Disconnect an input plug from an element of the encapsulated plug at a specific index after cleaning.

Note

Any packed element with a logical index greater than the removal index will be reconnected at a decremented index.

Parameters:index (int) – The index at which to remove an input connection after cleaning the encapsulated plug.
Raises:IndexError – If index is out of range after the encapsulated plug has been cleaned.
replace(index, inputPlug)¶

Replace an input connection to an element of the encapsulated plug corrresponding to a specific index after cleaning.

Parameters:
  • index (int) – The index at which to replace the existing connection after cleaning the encapsulated plug.
  • inputPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
Raises:
  • RuntimeError – If there are any connection issues between an input and a corresponding element plug. See connect().
  • IndexError – If index is out of range after the encapsulated plug has been cleaned.
class msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.PackCompoundArray(compoundArrayPlug, inputPlugGroups=None, allowMultiples=False, stateTracking=True)¶

Bases: msTools.core.py.metaclasses.AbstractAccessWrapper

An interface for managing input connections to the elemental children of a dependency node compound array plug.

Inputs:

When making a connection via the interface, each input must be given as a sequence containing OpenMaya.MPlug encapsulations of dependency node plugs. Each sequence is referred to as an input group for which each element will be connected as an input to a corresponding child of the next available element plug. The group of child plugs to which an input group connects is referred to as a child group.

  • Each input group must contain an equivalent number of values as there are children such that each input can be paired to a single child group plug.
  • Each input group can contain None values such that the corresponding child group plug will not receive a connection.
  • Each input group must contain at least one non-None value such that at least one child group plug receives a connection.

Cleaning:

The interface enforces a cleaning routine that is run as a preliminary step before querying or modifying existing connections. Cleaning of the array is implemented as clean().

Validation:

The interface provides the option to track the functional state of the internal OpenMaya.MPlug. When tracking is enabled, an msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaObjectError will be raised when attempting to access the interface of an invalid encapsulation. The isValid property and __repr__() method will remain accessible regardless of whether the functional state is invalid.

Note

Instances of this class maintain a unique reference to their internal OpenMaya.MPlug to ensure the referenced dependency node plug does not change. This enables the logical indices of the OpenMaya.MPlug to be cached for efficient comparison.

allowMultiples¶

Whether multiple elements of the encapsulated plug can be connected to a single input plug.

Access:RW
Type:bool
isConnected¶

True if at least one element of the encapsulated plug has a destination connection, otherwise False.

Access:R
Type:bool
isValid¶

True if the internal OpenMaya.MPlug references a valid dependency node plug, otherwise False.

Note

This method is not subject to stateTracking and is therefore accessible even if the encapsulated dependency node plug is removed.

Access:R
Type:bool
partialName¶

The partial name of the encapsulated plug with format '<node>.<plug>'.

  • <node> will be a partial node name qualified by a path and namespace where applicable or necessary. It is guaranteed to uniquely identify the plug’s node with the minimum amount of information necessary (partial path of a DAG node).
  • <plug> is guaranteed to uniquely identify the plug with the minimum amount of information necessary (short attribute path, short attribute names).
Access:R
Type:str
plug¶

A copy of the internal plug object.

Access:R
Type:OpenMaya.MPlug
plugId¶

Identifier for the internal OpenMaya.MPlug.

Access:R
Type:msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MPlugId
stateTracking¶

Whether to track the state of the internal OpenMaya.MPlug in order to restrict access to the public interface if invalid.

Restriction involves raising a msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaObjectError upon attempting to access a bound instance attribute from the public interface. The following bindings are excluded: __repr__(), isValid.

Access:RW
Type:bool
__eq__(other)¶

x.__eq__(y) <==> x == y.

Parameters:other (any) – Any object.
Returns:bool – If other has an equivalent type, return whether its contents (dependency node plug) are equivalent. Otherwise swap the operands and return the result, unless the operands have already been swapped in which case the result is False.
__init__(compoundArrayPlug, inputPlugGroups=None, allowMultiples=False, stateTracking=True)¶

Initialize an encapsulation for a dependency node compound array plug.

Parameters:
  • compoundArrayPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node compound array plug.
  • inputPlugGroups (iterable [iterable [OpenMaya.MPlug]], optional) – Sequences containing encapsulations of dependency node plugs. Each group of inputs is connected to the children of the next available compoundArrayPlug element. Defaults to None.
  • allowMultiples (bool, optional) – Whether multiple compoundArrayPlug child groups can be connected to a single group of input plugs. Defaults to False - Any existing duplicates will be removed from the tail end of the array.
  • stateTracking (bool, optional) – Whether to track the functional state of the compoundArrayPlug. Defaults to True - Access to the interface is conditional upon this state.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If compoundArrayPlug does not reference a dependency node compound array plug.

Returns:int – The number of destination connections to the encapsulated plug.

Parameters:other (any) – Any object.
Returns:bool – The negation of __eq__().
__repr__()¶

x.__repr__() <==> repr(x).

Note

This method is not subject to stateTracking and is therefore accessible even if the internal OpenMaya.MPlug is functionally invalid. In this case cached data is used.

Returns:str – A string representation of the dependency node plug encapsulation.
append(inputPlugGroup)¶

Connect a group of input plugs to the next available group of child plugs for an element of the encapsulated plug after cleaning.

Parameters:

inputPlugGroup (iterable [OpenMaya.MPlug]) – Sequence of dependency node plug encapsulations.
Raises:
  • RuntimeError – If there are any connection issues between an input and a corresponding child plug. See connect().
  • ValueError – If inputPlugGroup contains all None values.
  • ValueError – If inputPlugGroup contains the wrong number of inputs.
clean()¶

Removes sparcity from the encapsulated plug by removing any elements that contain a disconnected child group. Removes any duplicate input group connections from the tail end of the array if allowMultiples is False.

Note

This method acts as the basis for all query and modify operations provided by the PackCompoundArray interface.

Returns:(list [list [msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MPlugId, None]], list [list [msTools.core.maya.om_utils.MPlugId]]) – A two-element tuple.
  1. Sequences of dependency node plug encapsulations representing the input group plugs for each element of the encapsulated plug.
  2. Sequences of dependency node plug encapsulations representing the child group plugs for each element of the encapsulated plug.
clear()¶

Removes all input connections to elements of the encapsulated plug

copy(inputPlugGroups)¶

Replace all input group connections to child groups of the encapsulated plug with a new sequence of input groups.

Parameters:

inputPlugGroups (iterable [iterable [OpenMaya.MPlug]]) – Sequences of dependency node plug encapsulations.
Raises:
  • RuntimeError – If there are any connection issues between an input and a corresponding child plug. See connect().
  • ValueError – If any of the inputPlugGroups contain all None values.
  • ValueError – If any of the inputPlugGroups contain the wrong number of inputs.
extend(inputPlugGroups)¶

Connect groups of input plugs to the next available groups of child plugs for elements of the encapsulated plug after cleaning.

Parameters:

inputPlugGroups (iterable [iterable [OpenMaya.MPlug]]) – Sequences of dependency node plug encapsulations.
Raises:
  • RuntimeError – If there are any connection issues between an input and a corresponding child plug. See connect().
  • ValueError – If any of the inputPlugGroups contain all None values.
  • ValueError – If any of the inputPlugGroups contain the wrong number of inputs.

insert(index, inputPlugGroup)¶

Connect a group of input plugs to a group of child plugs for an element of the encapsulated plug corrresponding to a specific index after cleaning.

Note

Any packed element with a logical index greater or equal to the insertion index will be reconnected at an incremented index.

Parameters:
  • index (int) – The index at which to insert the inputPlugGroup connections after cleaning the encapsulated plug.
  • inputPlugGroup (iterable [OpenMaya.MPlug]) – Sequence of dependency node plug encapsulations.
Raises:

  • ValueError – If inputPlugGroup contains all None values.
  • ValueError – If inputPlugGroup contains the wrong number of inputs.

  • ValueError – If inputPlugGroup contains the wrong number of inputs.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.connect(sourcePlug, destPlug, forceConnected=False, forceLocked=False)¶

Connect two dependency node plugs.

Parameters:
  • sourcePlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug used as the source of the connection.
  • destPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug used as the destination of the connection.
  • forceConnected (bool, optional) – Whether to force the connection if destPlug is already connected. Defaults to False.
  • forceLocked (bool, optional) – Whether to force the connection if destPlug is locked. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If the data types of the plug attributes are incompatible.
  • RuntimeError – If either plug references an unconnectable attribute.
  • RuntimeError – If sourcePlug references an unreadable attribute.
  • RuntimeError – If destPlug references an unwritable attribute.
  • RuntimeError – If destPlug is globally locked and forceLocked is False.
  • RuntimeError – If destPlug is connected and forceConnected is False.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.disconnect(sourcePlug, destPlug, forceLocked=False)¶

Disconnect two dependency node plugs.

Parameters:
  • sourcePlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug representing the source of the connection.
  • destPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug representing the destination of the connection.
  • forceLocked (bool, optional) – Whether to force the disconnection if destPlug is locked. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • RuntimeError – If sourcePlug and destPlug are not connected.
  • RuntimeError – If destPlug is globally locked and forceLocked is False.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.getAncestor(plug)¶

Return the ancestor of an element or child plug.

Parameters:plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node element or child plug.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug is neither an element nor a child.
Returns:OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug for the ancestor of plug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.getChildByName(compoundPlug, attributeName)¶

Return a child of a non-array compound plug.

Parameters:
  • compoundPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node compound plug.
  • attributeName (basestring) – Name of an attribute that is a child of compoundPlug.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If compoundPlug is not a compound.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If compoundPlug is an array.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaLookupError – If attributeName does not correspond to a child of compoundPlug.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug for a child of arrayPlug corresponding to attributeName.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.getUnconnectedElement(arrayPlug, checkSource=True, checkDestination=True)¶

Returns the first unconnected element plug of an array plug.

Note

If the array is sparse and other elements are connected, the element will correspond to the smallest sparse logical index. If no element plugs are considered in-use, the element will correspond to the zeroth logical index.

Parameters:
  • arrayPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node array plug.
  • checkSource (bool, optional) – Whether to check the source side of the arrayPlug for connections. Defaults to True.
  • checkDestination (bool, optional) – Whether to check the destination side of the arrayPlug for connections. Defaults to True.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If checkSource and checkDestination are both False.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If arrayPlug is not an array.
Returns:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulation for the first unconnected element plug of arrayPlug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.getUnconnectedLogicalIndex(arrayPlug, checkSource=True, checkDestination=True)¶

Returns the logical index for the first unconnected element plug of an array plug.

Note

If the array is sparse and other elements are connected, the smallest sparse index will be returned. If no element plugs are considered in-use, the zeroth index will be returned.

Parameters:
  • arrayPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node array plug.
  • checkSource (bool, optional) – Whether to check the source side of the arrayPlug for connections. Defaults to True.
  • checkDestination (bool, optional) – Whether to check the destination side of the arrayPlug for connections. Defaults to True.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If checkSource and checkDestination are both False.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If arrayPlug is not an array.
Returns:

int – Logical index for the first unconnected element plug of arrayPlug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.getUnusedElement(arrayPlug)¶

Return the next available unused element plug of an array plug.

Note

If the array is sparse, the element will correspond to the smallest sparse logical index. If no element plugs are considered in-use, the element will correspond to the zeroth logical index.

Parameters:arrayPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node array plug.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If arrayPlug is not an array.
Returns:OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulation for the next available unused element plug of arrayPlug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.getUnusedLogicalIndex(arrayPlug)¶

Returns the logical index for the next available unused element plug of an array plug.

Note

If the array is sparse, the smallest sparse index will be returned. If no element plugs are considered in-use, the zeroth index will be returned.

Parameters:arrayPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node array plug.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If arrayPlug is not an array.
Returns:int – Logical index for the next available unused element of arrayPlug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.getValue(plug)¶

Get the value held by a plug.

Supported attribute types are: OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Float, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Int, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Short, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Float, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Int, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Short, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute4Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kDoubleLinearAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatLinearAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kDoubleAngleAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatAngleAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kTimeAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kMatrixAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatMatrixAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kTypedAttribute. Type OpenMaya.MFn.kCompoundAttribute is also supported if each child attribute corresponds to one of the afformentioned types.

Supported data types for OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute are: OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kBoolean, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kChar, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kByte, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kShort, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kInt, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kLong, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kAddr, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kInt64, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kFloat, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kDouble.

Supported data types for OpenMaya.MFn.kTypedAttribute are: OpenMaya.MFnData.kInvalid, OpenMaya.MFnData.kMatrix, OpenMaya.MFnData.kNumeric, OpenMaya.MFnData.kString, OpenMaya.MFnData.kStringArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kDoubleArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kIntArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kPointArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kVectorArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList.

Note

If plug references a typed attribute with OpenMaya.MFnData.kString or OpenMaya.MFnData.kStringArray data type, an attempt will be made to json deserialize the data held by the plug.

Parameters:

plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug is an array.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug is a compound with a child array or compound.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug references an unsupported attribute type.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug references a numeric or typed attribute with an unsupported data type.
Returns:

any – plug data.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.isLocked(plug, checkInternalState=False)¶

Return whether a dependency node plug is internally or globally locked.

Note

The global lock state of a plug is influenced by the lock state of each ancestor. A plug can be globally locked whilst also being internally unlocked. See note-5.

This method is designed as an alternative to OpenMaya.MPlug.isLocked which is not always reliable. See warning-1.

Parameters:
  • plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
  • checkInternalState (bool, optional) – Whether to check if plug is internally locked. Defaults to False.
Returns:

bool – The lock state of plug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.iterAncestors(plug)¶

Yield ancestors of an element or child plug.

Parameters:plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node element or child plug.
Raises:msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug is neither an element nor a child.
Yields:OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs for the ancestors of plug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.iterChildren(compoundPlug)¶

Yield the children of a non-array compound plug.

compoundPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node compound plug.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If compoundPlug is not a compound.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If compoundPlug is an array.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs for the children of arrayPlug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.iterConnectedElements(arrayPlug, checkSource=True, checkDestination=True)¶

Yield the connected elements of an array plug.

Parameters:
  • arrayPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node array plug.
  • checkSource (bool, optional) – Whether to check the source side of the arrayPlug for connections. Defaults to True.
  • checkDestination (bool, optional) – Whether to check the destination side of the arrayPlug for connections. Defaults to True.
Raises:
  • ValueError – If checkSource and checkDestination are both False.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If arrayPlug is not an array.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulations of the connected dependency node element plugs for the arrayPlug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.iterDescendants(plug, forceInitialElements=True)¶

Yield descendants of an array or compound plug.

Parameters:
  • plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node array or compound plug.
  • forceInitialElements (bool, optional) – Whether to return the zeroth indexed element of each array plug if there are no existing elements. If False, traversal of the descendant hierarchy will terminate upon reaching an array plug that has no in-use elements. If True, it is guaranteed that the full descendant hierarchy of plug will be traversed. Defaults to True.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug is neither an array nor a compound.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs for the descendants of plug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.iterElements(arrayPlug, forceInitialElement=False)¶

Yield the existing elements of an array plug.

Parameters:
  • arrayPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node array plug.
  • forceInitialElement (bool, optional) – Whether to return the zeroth indexed element of the arrayPlug if there are no existing elements. Defaults to False.
Raises:

msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If arrayPlug is not an array.
Yields:

OpenMaya.MPlug – Encapsulations of the dependency node element plugs for the arrayPlug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.removeElement(elementPlug, forceConnected=False, forceLocked=False)¶

Remove an element plug.

Parameters:
  • elementPlug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node element plug.
  • forceConnected (bool, optional) – Whether to force the removal if elementPlug or one of its descendants is connected. Defaults to False.
  • forceLocked (bool, optional) – Whether to force the removal if elementPlug is locked. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If elementPlug is not an element plug.
  • RuntimeError – If elementPlug is locked and forceLocked is False.
  • RuntimeError – If elementPlug or one of its descendants is connected and forceConnected is False.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.setProperties(plug, **kwargs)¶

Set properties corresponding to any writable property on OpenMaya.MPlug for any encapsulated plug. Changes are placed on the undo queue.

Note

See note-1.

Parameters:
  • plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments where each argument corresponds to a writable property on OpenMaya.MPlug such as OpenMaya.MPlug.isCaching, OpenMaya.MPlug.isChannelBox, OpenMaya.MPlug.isKeyable, OpenMaya.MPlug.isLocked.

Examples

# Unlock `plug` and set keyable
setProperties(plug, isKeyable=True, isLocked=False)
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.setValue(plug, value, forceLocked=False)¶

Set the value held by a plug.

Supported attribute types are: OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Float, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Int, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute2Short, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Float, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Int, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute3Short, OpenMaya.MFn.kAttribute4Double, OpenMaya.MFn.kDoubleLinearAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatLinearAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kDoubleAngleAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatAngleAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kTimeAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kMatrixAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kFloatMatrixAttribute, OpenMaya.MFn.kTypedAttribute. Type OpenMaya.MFn.kCompoundAttribute is also supported if each child attribute corresponds to one of the afformentioned types.

Supported data types for OpenMaya.MFn.kNumericAttribute are: OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kBoolean, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kChar, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kByte, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kShort, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kInt, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kLong, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kAddr, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kInt64, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kFloat, OpenMaya.MFnNumericData.kDouble.

Supported data types for OpenMaya.MFn.kTypedAttribute are: OpenMaya.MFnData.kInvalid, OpenMaya.MFnData.kMatrix, OpenMaya.MFnData.kString, OpenMaya.MFnData.kStringArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kDoubleArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kIntArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kPointArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kVectorArray, OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList.

Note

If plug references a typed attribute with OpenMaya.MFnData.kString or OpenMaya.MFnData.kStringArray data type, an attempt will be made to json serialize the value if it does not reference str castable data.

Parameters:
  • plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
  • value (any) – Data used to update the value held by plug. The type must be compatible with the data type of the plug attribute.
  • forceLocked (bool, optional) – Whether to force set the value if plug is locked. Defaults to False.
Raises:
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug is an array.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug is a compound with a child array or compound.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug references a typed attribute which holds OpenMaya.MFnData.kComponentList type data and the OpenMaya.MObject value does not reference OpenMaya.MFn.kComponent type data.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug references an unsupported attribute type.
  • msTools.core.maya.exceptions.MayaTypeError – If plug references a numeric or typed attribute with an unsupported data type.
  • TypeError – If the value type is not supported by plug.
  • ValueError – If plug requires a sequence of values which has a different length to the value sequence.
  • RuntimeError – If plug has an input connection.
  • RuntimeError – If plug is locked and forceLocked is False.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.unlockGlobal(plug)¶

Globally unlock a plug by ensuring any locked ancestor is also unlocked.

Note

The global lock state of a plug is influenced by the lock state of each ancestor. A plug can be globally locked whilst also being internally unlocked. See note-5.

Parameters:plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
Returns:list [OpenMaya.MPlug] – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs that have been unlocked, ordered from the furthest ancestor of plug.
msTools.core.maya.plug_utils.unlockRelatives(plug)¶

Unlock all ancestors and descendants of a plug.

Designed for use before removing an attribute. Any descendant plug which is locked and connected must be unlocked in order to remove an attribute.

Parameters:plug (OpenMaya.MPlug) – Encapsulation of a dependency node plug.
Returns:list [OpenMaya.MPlug] – Encapsulations of dependency node plugs that have been unlocked, ordered from furthest ancestor to furthest descendant of plug.
